title: Vitamins in Human Body
description: Essential micronutrients required for normal metabolic function, growth, and overall health, typically obtained through diet. They are vital for diverse bodily processes, including energy production, immune defense, and cellular repair, playing a crucial role in preventing various diseases and maintaining overall well-being.

children.title: Dietary Sources
children.description: Vitamins are obtained from various dietary sources including fruits, vegetables, dairy products, meats, and fortified foods.

children.title: Fruits & Vegetables
children.summary: Rich in vitamins C, A, K
children.description: Fresh produce provides essential vitamins.

children.title: Meat & Dairy
children.description: Animal products are excellent sources of B vitamins.

children.title: Grains & Nuts
children.description: Whole grains provide B vitamins and vitamin E.

children.title: Fortified & Enriched
children.description: Processed foods fortified with vitamins.

children.title: Health Impact & Balance
children.description: Maintaining adequate vitamin levels is crucial, as both deficiencies (hypovitaminosis) and excesses (hypervitaminosis) can lead to health problems. These imbalances can manifest in a range of symptoms and conditions, significantly affecting long-term health and quality of life if not addressed.

children.title: Deficiency
children.description: Vitamin deficiencies can lead to serious conditions.

children.title: Excess
children.description: Excessive intake can cause toxicity.

children.title: Key Bodily Roles
children.description: Vitamins play crucial roles in energy metabolism, immune function, bone health, and more.

children.title: Antioxidant Protection
children.description: Vitamins C and E protect from oxidative stress.

children.title: Bone Health
children.description: Vitamins D and K for bone mineralization.

children.title: Immune System Support
children.description: Vitamins A, C, D support immune function.

children.title: Energy Metabolism
children.description: B vitamins convert food to energy.

children.title: Vitamin Classification
children.description: Vitamins are primarily classified based on their solubility in fats or water, which dictates their absorption, storage, and excretion mechanisms in the body. This fundamental distinction influences dietary intake recommendations, potential for toxicity, and how they are utilized by different physiological systems.

children.title: Fat-Soluble Vitamins
children.description: Vitamins A, D, E, K stored in liver and fatty tissues.

children.title: Vitamin A
children.description: Essential for vision and immune function.

children.title: Vitamin D
children.description: Crucial for calcium absorption.

children.title: Vitamin K
children.description: Essential for blood clotting.

children.title: Water-Soluble Vitamins
children.description: B-complex and vitamin C dissolve in water.

children.title: Vitamin C
children.description: Important for immune function.

children.title: B-Complex Vitamins
children.description: Essential for energy metabolism.
